page.title: 02PORTWAY FARM, OAKHAM
page.content: It is surprising to find a farm in the heart of the Black Country. Portway Farm is situated on Portway Hill, approximately one and a half miles S.W. of Oldbury town centre. The black and white farmhouse is one of the oldest buildings in the area. Parts of the building date back to the 1400's, with additions made in the sixteenth century. It is built of wattle and daub and was a Tudor coach station. The farm covers an area of 25 acres and is managed by the farmer and his wife with two helpers on the governmment Youth Opportunities Programme. No crops are grown on the farm. The farmer keeps up to 40 beef cattle, 10,000 deep litter hens and 12 horses, which form part of a riding stable.
